page.title: 09Major D.S Allhusen
page.content: Today,having been for many years a farm house,Claxton and the surronding estate are owned by Major D.S Allhusen ,High Sheriff of Norfolk in 1959,the well_known Olympic horseman,who farms it on an extensive scale and takes a vivid interest in his historic home and land.He owns not only Claxton but the much more extensive remains of the once great Premonstratension Abbey of Langley,most of which is incorporated in farm buildings at Langley Dyke,not far from the banks of the Yare.Major Allhusen's coat of arms,inheritedfrim his Danish ancestors,who came here in 1824,includes a demi_lion guardant, holding in the dexter paw a passion cross between two buffalo horns, clearly an heraldic echo of the horned helmets of his Viking forbears.
